New Records: Jalen Johnson scored 29 points, but no other records were broken
Key Match Events: The Hawks pulled away for good with a 14-0 run in the middle of the fourth quarter that made it 116-97.
David Roddy ignited it with a 3 and Johnson had three dunks during the spurt.
The Pelicans were outscored 66-32 in the paint.
Pre-Game Insights: Pelicans star forward Zion Williamson was scratched from the lineup with right hamstring tightness.
The Hawks played without starter Deâ€™Andre Hunter, plus rotation players Bogdan Bogdanovic, Vit Krejci and Kobe Bufkin due to injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Hawks: Daniels and Nance didn't hide the satisfaction they got from producing against the club that traded them last offseason.
Pelicans: Young reserves hustled but lacked the firepower to stay with Atlanta.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brandon Ingram scored 32, but it wasn't enough to overcome a Hawks squad with six players with at least 11 points.
Trae Young scored 23, while former Pelican Dyson Daniels, back from a two-game injury absence, added 16 for Atlanta.
Larry Nance Jr. scored 14 against his former team.
Others: The Hawks snapped a four-game skid with a 126-111 victory over the short-handed New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday night.
New Orleans was also without starters Dejounte Murray, CJ McCollum, and Herb Jones, along with prominent reserve Trey Murphy III.
